ISSUE.TITLE: Support throwing BPMN Errors from executionListeners and taskListener

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Change subScopeId to planItemInstanceId in the CMMN VariableInstanceResponse (#3441)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: #3452 Support throwing bpmn error executionListener
#3452 Support throwing bpmn error executionListener
#3452 Support throwing bpmn error executionListener

#3452 Try to fix HttpServiceTaskSpringWebClientTest.testHandleStatusCodes * The execution is marked as ended in ErrorPropagation before (line 233 deleteChildExecutions) * When the planTriggerExecutionOperation() is called, the execution must be set to ended=false, otherwise the operation gets planned, but nothing gets executed for the boundaryEvent.
#3452 Handle MultiInstance subprocess * Added Test scenarios for multi instance subprocesses (sequential and parallel)
#3452 Handle MultiInstance subprocess * Added Test scenarios for multi instance subprocesses (sequential and parallel)
#3452 Support throwing bpmn error executionListener

#3452 Try to fix HttpServiceTaskSpringWebClientTest.testHandleStatusCodes * The execution is marked as ended in ErrorPropagation before (line 233 deleteChildExecutions) * When the planTriggerExecutionOperation() is called, the execution must be set to ended=false, otherwise the operation gets planned, but nothing gets executed for the boundaryEvent.
#3452 Handle MultiInstance subprocess * Added Test scenarios for multi instance subprocesses (sequential and parallel)
#3452 Handle MultiInstance subprocess * Added Test for multi instance parallel handled by boundary event (still failing)
#3452 Move ErrorPropagation to listener calling code

#3452 Support throwing BPMNError from executionListeners BPMNErrors thrown from executionListeners can now be handled in error Event Sub-Process or boundary events from sub process invocations in the model. ErrorBoundary events on the activity where the executionListeners are defined are not invoked. Instead, a parent event handler is looked up, when an executionListener throws an BPMNError and invoked, if found. This is to be consistent with the execution behavior of timer boundary events and signal boundary events.
